name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

key_work.title: Magic lantern slides
key_work.brief_description: Magic lantern slides are as varied as they are enchanting. While early slides featured line etchings on glass plates, lanternists were soon hand-painting them to give projections vibrancy and depth. When photography arrived in the 1840s, photos started appearing on lantern slides.

constellations_primary.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes

end.title: Magic lantern slide (Jupiter and its four moons)

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

links.description: We’ve been studying the stars for as long as humans have looked skyward. It’s no surprise that once magic lantern slides and projectors were used to educate people, one of the earliest uses were to teach people astronomy and bring the heavens to earth.

end.title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

video_links.name: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

end.brief_description: Melies’ fantastical vision of life on the moon.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

links.description: In 1902, magician and film pioneer Georges Méliès used his remarkable imagination and mastery of early special effects to take audiences on a fantastical trip to the moon where astronomers encounter cave-dwelling aliens after crashing their rocket into the Moon’s surface.

start.title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

video_links.name: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

start.brief_description: Melies’ fantastical vision of life on the moon.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

end.title: Moon landing
end.brief_description: On 21 July 1969, Neil Armstrong and Edwin ‘Buzz’ Aldrin became the first people to walk on the Moon. Through a global satellite network, this historic event was broadcast around the world and united an estimated 600 million people in a single moment.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

links.description: It would be over 65 years until humans actually did land on the Moon’s surface, when the Apollo 11 spacecraft touched down and united the world with an estimated 500 million people watching the moment Buzz Aldrin took one giant leap for mankind.

start.title: Moon landing
start.brief_description: On 21 July 1969, Neil Armstrong and Edwin ‘Buzz’ Aldrin became the first people to walk on the Moon. Through a global satellite network, this historic event was broadcast around the world and united an estimated 600 million people in a single moment.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

end.title: First still of Black Hole
end.brief_description: The Event Horizon Telescope—a planet-scale array of ground-based radio telescopes—has obtained the first image of a supermassive black hole and its shadow. The image, taken in 2019, reveals the central black hole of Messier 87, a massive galaxy in the Virgo cluster.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Distortions in Spacetime constellation (placeholder)
constellations_other.description: In 1916, Albert Einstein predicted black holes through his theory of general relativity. That mix of science and imagination can be seen in Marshmallow Laser Feast’s Distortions in Spacetime. These other works are fascinated by these cosmic giants and represent an evolution in computer graphics and VFX.

links.description: In 2019, the first-ever image of a black hole 55 million light-years away was captured by Katie Bouman and the Event Horizon Telescope, an astronomical event that captured imaginations like the first moon landing.

start.title: First still of Black Hole

end.title: Mass Effect 2
end.brief_description: After being revived from death and having to join a pro-human organization without a choice, Commander Shepard must assemble a team, battle a new threat, and make tough choices in order to save the galaxy from total annihilation once more.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Distortions in Spacetime constellation (placeholder)
constellations_other.description: In 1916, Albert Einstein predicted black holes through his theory of general relativity. That mix of science and imagination can be seen in Marshmallow Laser Feast’s Distortions in Spacetime. These other works are fascinated by these cosmic giants and represent an evolution in computer graphics and VFX.

links.description: The bad guys in Bioware’s sprawling space opera hide out on the event horizon of a black hole – with visual designs based on scientific predictions that turned out to be amazingly similar to actual black hole images captured in 2019.

start.title: Mass Effect 2
start.brief_description: After being revived from death and having to join a pro-human organization without a choice, Commander Shepard must assemble a team, battle a new threat, and make tough choices in order to save the galaxy from total annihilation once more.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes

That mix of science and imagination can be seen in Marshmallow Laser Feast’s Distortions in Spacetime. end.title: Solaris
end.brief_description: A psychologist is sent to a space station orbiting a planet called Solaris to investigate the death of a doctor and the mental problems of cosmonauts on the station. He soon discovers that the water on the planet brings out repressed memories and obsessions.

constellations_other.name: Returning to Solaris
constellations_other.description: Stanislaw Lem’s novel Solaris (1961) tells the haunting story of a space research expedition’s encounter with a sentient ocean planet. Here we look at how different artists have responded to, remixed and referenced Solaris over film, television, and videogames.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

links.description: There are many references to Andrei Tarkovsky’s work throughout Mass Effect, including planetary bodies that mirror the oceanic world of Solaris and the name of the largest armour corporation.

start.title: Solaris
start.brief_description: A psychologist is sent to a space station orbiting a planet called Solaris to investigate the death of a doctor and the mental problems of cosmonauts on the station. He soon discovers that the water on the planet brings out repressed memories and obsessions.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

end.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1968
end.brief_description: Humanity finds a mysterious object buried beneath the lunar surface and sets off to find its origins with the help of HAL 9000, the world’s most advanced super computer, in Stanley Kubrick’s masterpiece, which pushed cinematic narratives and special effects.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

constellations_other.name: The Kubrick connection
constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

constellations_other.name: Sublime light and special effects
constellations_other.description: Explore 19th-century artist John Martin’s surprising influence on science fiction and fantasy films of the 20th century, from Jason and the Argonauts to the Lord of the Rings and the Evil Dead franchises.

links.description: Tarkovsky’s Solaris was partly inspired by his disdain for other speculative fiction films, in particular Stanley Kubrick’s 2001, which he described as ‘phony on many levels’ and ‘a lifeless schema with only pretensions to truth’.

end.title: Moon landing
end.brief_description: On 21 July 1969, Neil Armstrong and Edwin ‘Buzz’ Aldrin became the first people to walk on the Moon. Through a global satellite network, this historic event was broadcast around the world and united an estimated 600 million people in a single moment.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

links.description: Many conspiracy theorists have claimed that the footage of the moon landing was faked in order to win the Space Race between the USA and the USSR, with further claims it was shot by Kubrick following his work on 2001.
